tool.name: xcms.xcmsSet Merger
tool.description: Merge xcms.xcmsSet xset in one to be used by group

configfiles.configfile:
suppressPackageStartupMessages(library(xcms, quietly=TRUE))
images=c( "${"\",\"".join(map(str, $images))}" )
cat("\tXSET MERGING...\n")
for(image in images) { load(image) cat(sampleNamesList\$sampleNamesOrigin,"\n") if (!exists("xset_merged")) xset_merged=xset else xset_merged=c(xset_merged,xset) } xset=xset_merged; rm(xset_merged)
#if str($sampleMetadata) != 'None': cat("\tXSET PHENODATA SETTING...\n") sampleMetadata=read.table("$sampleMetadata", h=F, sep=";") if (ncol(sampleMetadata) < 2) sampleMetadata=read.table("$sampleMetadata", h=F, sep="\t") if (ncol(sampleMetadata) < 2) sampleMetadata=read.table("$sampleMetadata", h=F, sep=",") if (ncol(sampleMetadata) < 2) { error_message="Your sampleMetadata file seems not well formatted. The column separators accepted are ; , and tabulation" print(error_message) stop(error_message) }
sampclass(xset)=sampleMetadata\$V2[match(rownames(xset@phenoData),sampleMetadata\$V1)] #end if
cat("\tXSET OBJECT INFO\n")
print(xset@phenoData) print(xset)
save.image("$xsetRData")

param.name: sampleMetadata
param.label: Sample metadata file
param.help: must contain at least one column with the sample id and one column with the sample class

tool.help:
@HELP_AUTHORS@
=================== Xcms.xcmsSet Merger ===================
----------- Description -----------
This tool will allow you to run one xcms.xcmsSet process per sample in parallel and then to merge all RData images in one. The result is then suitable for group.
You can provide a sampleMetadata table to attribute phenotypic value to your samples.
---------------------------------------------------
